Esquire, I.C.s Political Ak’ont, Balimjjn. o ^ r»oUUJ.J v: • To The District Commissioner, Mombasa., Sir onyn Colony. I have the honour to infonn you that I iiave received an enquiry from a local trader who is interested in exporting simsin and cocoanut oil from Mombasa. He wishes to know what are the rules concerning export in force in Kenya. I shall bo grateful if you will kindly send the necessary information for his and my guidance. I have the honour to bo, Sir, Your most obedient servant Political Agent, Bahrain.6 No.FC/, fjy/k*. Messrs Haji Mohamed Maki Albahar,^na, Bahrain. THE CUSTOMHOUSE: BAHRAIN: 29th July, 194-4., Dear Sir, Reference attached. If you will apply to H.B.M'Jical Agent, you will be given a No Objection Certificate for simsim oil, only. DIRECTOR OF CUSTOMS AND PORT OFFICER, BAHRAIN. Enel— \TSLEti IiA MS :• “LUCRATIVE ^~Y £— AII.IKH.VI PANJU & teOA.--. Lamu (Kenya Colony), Usumbura (Riumda Urundi). Codes used *~~<S2} » A.b.C. 5TH » 6TH EDITIONS P. O. BOX 59. BENTLEY S & ORIENTAL T ”' S ' 28thjune 4 PANJU RICE MILL } UJIJI. 1 TELEPHONE no. 758 L Messrs. Haji Mohamed Maki Albabarejia. Bahrain. Dear Sirs. We thank you for your kind letter of the 9th Instant, contents of which have dully noted with thanks As really we have been very pleased to understand the quotations of the goods from you. and kindly request you to please let us know the quotations of all goods by every host. As we have drwan our attention to your letter to send you a trial consignment, tut before sending the consignment we should like to know wether there is any restiction at yours on Imp ortationMfMmxfHREXiRy Marie RJ^'goods from fore in count r and can you arrange to furnish us the Import Licence duly signed by the authority tax for allowing you to Import goods from Mombasa. And if you could arrange to send the import Licenc it would be very convenience to us for make you the consignment and you may try to obtain Import Licence of the following goods 100 Tons Sugar. 100 Tons Tea. 300. Tons Coffee. 50. Tons Simsimoil. 50.Tons Coconut oil. We shall be very glad to hear from you^your news and also expecting to receive the above mentioned Import Licence, from you by return of Post (Airmail) ,y e are sending you today under seprate coyer one sam le containg one Pocket of i'obacco (Manufactured in this country) on receivinp' you the above sample please let us know at once that at what rate you can dispose of same in your market per dozen. „ ^ . .. ■wishing you we may build up our mutualu business connections with' you MxfuiHXRxfor faithfully. Shay p/.lju & sa I /Ref.No.T&C 5/1/A. DISTRICT COMMISSIONER'S OFFICE, MOMBASA. 9th August, 1944. \ The Political Agent, o bahr a. nanr*an Ke s.pt Sir, ( V \ I have the honour to ackriowledge the receipt of your letter No.2155-36/7$ of 26th July, 1944 on the subject of the export of Simsim and Cocoanut oil from Mombasd. 2. It is regretted that the commodities in question are in such a short supply in this country and it is unlikely that any exports can be allowed. 5. The authority for dealing in export# etc. of produce is, however, the East African Proauction and Supply Council, P.O.Box 1091, Nairobi to whom a copy of your letter and this renly are sent with a request that they should communicate with you direct. I have the honour to be. Sir, Your obedient servant, mah/ra. Copv to: The Secretary, ^ ^ The E.A.P.&S. Council, DISTRICT COMMISSIONER. P.O.Box 10 91,Nairobi, together with a copy of letter No.2135-36/72 from the Political Agent, Bahrain.EAST AFRICAN PRODUCTION AND SUPPLY COUNCIL .Telegrams: Telephone No. In _ply please quote No. .(VSB.24$AT/87 P.O.BOX 1091, NAIROBI, KENYA COLONY. 'Vi'*. . 12th August, 1944. The Political Agent, BAHRAIN® Bahrain 0 J^?. <0.,?.^.. Date Sir, I have the honour to refer to your letter No.2135-36/72 of the 26th July addressed to the District Commissioner, Mombasa, and to confirm that, in view of the supply position, no export of simsim and coconut oil from Mombasa can be Allowed. I am. Sir, Your obedient servant, for DIRSCTORi^RODUCE DISPOSAL.- ■ no.^$y- 36/72. To Political Agency, Bahrain ? ^ The ^X^October, 1944* & Ur» Haji Mohamed Makki Alb ah a rn ah, Bahrain. ■v Memorandum . Reference your application dated the 12th August, 1944 regarding import of 50 tons simsim oil from Mombasa. 2. I have been informed by the Government authorities of Mombasa that in view of the supply position, no export of simsim and coconut oil from Mombasa can be allowed. Y ■ Political Agent, Bahrain. * lMr**'INDIA OFFICE RECORDS ^ nit

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 11; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-9; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence related to a request made to the Political Agency by a Bahraini merchant named Mohamed Makki Albaharnah to import simsim [sesame] oil from Mombasa, Kenya into Bahrain.This request was refused by the East African Production and Supply Council due to shortages in the area and this decision was then reported back to Albaharnah by the Political Agency.
